00041 
00042 static std::string
00043 mygetenv(const std::string& var, const std::string& val = "")
00044 {
00045   const char* res = getenv(var.c_str());
00046   return res ? std::string(res) : val;
00047 }
00048 
00049 static std::string
00050 urbi_getenv(const std::string& self, const std::string& _var, const std::string& val = "")
00051 {
00052   std::string var = "URBI_" + _var;
00053   const char* res = getenv(var.c_str());
00054   if (res)
00055   {
00056     std::cerr << self << ": obeying to " << var << " = " << res << std::endl;
00057     return res;
00058   }
00059   else
00060     return val;
00061 }

00067 static bool
00068 debug()
00069 {
00070   static bool res = mygetenv("GD_LEVEL") == "DUMP";
00071   return res;
00072 }
00073 
00074 # define URBI_ROOT_ECHO(S)                      \
00075   std::cerr << S << std::endl                   \
00076 
00077 # define URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(Self, S)               \
00078   do {                                          \
00079     if (debug())                                \
00080       URBI_ROOT_ECHO(Self << ": " << S);        \
00081   } while (0)
00082 
00083 # define URBI_ROOT_FATAL(Self, N, S)            \
00084   do {                                          \
00085     URBI_ROOT_ECHO(Self << ": " << S);          \
00086     exit(N);                                    \
00087   } while (0)

00093 static const std::string libext =
00094                            APPLE_LINUX_WINDOWS(".dylib", ".so", ".dll");
00095 static const std::string separator =
00096                            APPLE_LINUX_WINDOWS("/", "/", "\\");
00097 static const std::string libdir =
00098                            APPLE_LINUX_WINDOWS("lib", "lib", "bin");
00099 
00101 static
00102 std::string
00103 operator/(const std::string& lhs, const std::string& rhs)
00104 {
00105   return (lhs.empty() ? rhs
00106           : rhs.empty() ? lhs
00107           : lhs + separator + rhs);
00108 }

00110 /*-------------------------------------.
00111 | Crapy dynamic portability routines.  |
00112 `-------------------------------------*/
00113 
00114 #ifdef WIN32
00115 #define RTLD_LAZY 0
00116 #define RTLD_NOW 0
00117 #define RTLD_GLOBAL 0
00118 
00119 static RTLD_HANDLE
00120 dlopen(const char* name, int)
00121 {
00122   RTLD_HANDLE res = LoadLibrary(name);
00123   if (res)
00124   {
00125     char buf[BUFSIZ];
00126     GetModuleFileName(res, buf, sizeof buf - 1);
00127     buf[sizeof buf - 1] = 0;
00128   }
00129   return res;
00130 }
00131 
00132 static void*
00133 dlsym(RTLD_HANDLE module, const char* name)
00134 {
00135   return static_cast<void*>(GetProcAddress(module, name));
00136 }
00137 
00138 static const char*
00139 dlerror(DWORD err = GetLastError())
00140 {
00141   static char buf[1024];
00142 
00143   FormatMessage(FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM | FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS,
00144                 0, err, 0,
00145                 (LPTSTR)buf, sizeof buf,
00146                 0);
00147 
00148   return buf;
00149 }
00150 
00151 #else
00152 # include <dlfcn.h>
00153 #endif
00154 
00155 typedef std::vector<std::string> strings_type;
00156 static strings_type
00157 split(std::string lib)
00158 {
00159   strings_type res;
00160   size_t pos = lib.find(':');
00161 
00162   if ((pos = lib.find(':')) == lib.npos)
00163   {
00164     res.push_back(lib);
00165     return res;
00166   }
00167 
00168   do
00169   {
00170     std::string s = lib.substr(0, pos);
00171     if (pos != lib.npos)
00172     {
00173       lib = lib.substr(pos + 1, lib.npos);
00174       pos = lib.find(':');
00175     }
00176     else
00177       lib.clear();
00178 
00179 #ifdef WIN32
00180     // Colon could be used as a path separator under cygwin and as a volume
00181     // separator under windows.
00182     if (s[0] == '\\' && !res.empty())
00183     {
00184       std::string& back = res.back();
00185       size_t back_len = back.length();
00186 
00187       // In case we split "c:\foo" into "c" and "\foo", glue them
00188       // together again.
00189       if (back_len == 1)
00190         back += ':' + s;
00191 
00192       // In case we split "bar;c:\foo" into "bar;c" and "\foo", split them
00193       // into "bar" and "c:\foo"
00194       else if (back_len >= 2 && back[back_len - 2] == ';')
00195       {
00196         s = std::string("") + back[back_len - 1] + ':' + s;
00197         back = back.substr(0, back_len - 2);
00198         res.push_back(s);
00199       }
00200     }
00201     else
00202       res.push_back(s);
00203 #else
00204     res.push_back(s);
00205 #endif
00206 
00207   } while (!lib.empty());
00208 
00209   return res;
00210 }
00211 
00213 static
00214 RTLD_HANDLE
00215 xdlopen(const std::string& program,
00216         const std::string& msg,
00217         std::string path,
00218         sysexit status = EX_FAIL,
00219         int flags = RTLD_LAZY | RTLD_GLOBAL)
00220 {
00221   path += libext;
00222   URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program, "loading library: " << path << " (" << msg << ")");
00223   if (RTLD_HANDLE res = dlopen(path.c_str(), flags))
00224     return res;
00225   else
00226     URBI_ROOT_FATAL(program, status,
00227                     "cannot open library: " << path << ": " << dlerror());
00228 }
00229 
00230 template <typename Res>
00231 static
00232 Res
00233 xdlsym(const std::string& program,
00234        const char* modname, RTLD_HANDLE module,
00235        const char* name)
00236 {
00237   URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program, "loading symbol " << name << " from " << modname);
00238   // Reinterpret-cast fails with gcc3 arm.
00239   if (Res res = (Res)(dlsym(module, name)))
00240     return res;
00241   else
00242     URBI_ROOT_FATAL(program, 2,
00243                     "cannot locate " << name << " symbol: " << dlerror());
00244 }
00245 
00246 
00247 static
00248 std::string
00249 resolve_symlinks(const std::string& logname, const std::string& s)
00250 {
00251 #if defined WIN32
00252   return s;
00253 #else
00254   char path[BUFSIZ];
00255   strncpy(path, s.c_str(), BUFSIZ);
00256   path[BUFSIZ - 1] = 0;
00257   while (readlink(path, path, BUFSIZ) != -1)
00258     URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(logname, "unrolling symbolic link: " << path);
00259   return path;
00260 #endif
00261 }

00263 /*-----------.
00264 | UrbiRoot.  |
00265 `-----------*/
00266 
00267 UrbiRoot::UrbiRoot(const std::string& program, bool static_build)
00268   : program_(program)
00269   , root_()
00270   , handle_libjpeg_(0)
00271   , handle_libport_(0)
00272   , handle_libsched_(0)
00273   , handle_liburbi_(0)
00274   , handle_libuobject_(0)
00275 {
00276   // Find our directory.
00277   std::string uroot = urbi_getenv(program, "ROOT");
00278   if (!uroot.empty())
00279   {
00280     URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_,
00281                     "URBI_ROOT is set, forcing root directory: " << root_);
00282     root_ = uroot;
00283   }
00284   else
00285   {
00286     URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "guessing Urbi root: invoked as: " << program_);
00287     // Handle the chained symlinks case.
00288     std::string argv0 = resolve_symlinks(program_, program);
00289 
00290 #ifdef WIN32
00291     size_t pos = argv0.find_last_of("/\\");
00292     {
00293       size_t dot = argv0.find_last_of(".");
00294       if (dot == argv0.npos || argv0.substr(dot + 1) != "exe")
00295         argv0 += ".exe";
00296     }
00297 #else
00298     size_t pos = argv0.rfind('/');
00299 #endif
00300     if (pos == std::string::npos)
00301     {
00302       struct stat stats;
00303       std::string dir, file;
00304       bool found = false;
00305 
00306 #ifdef WIN32
00307       URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_,
00308                       "check if invoked from the current directory");
00309 
00310       {
00311         char *dir_buf = getcwd(0, 0);
00312         std::string dir(dir_buf);
00313         free(dir_buf);
00314         file = dir / argv0;
00315       }
00316 
00317       found = stat(file.c_str(), &stats) == 0;
00318       if (!found)
00319       {
00320         URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "not found: " << file);
00321 #endif
00322         URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_,
00323                         "check if invoked from the path");
00324         strings_type path = split(mygetenv("PATH"));
00325         foreach (const std::string& dir_, path)
00326         {
00327           file = dir_ / argv0;
00328           found = stat(file.c_str(), &stats) == 0;
00329           if (found)
00330           {
00331             dir = dir_;
00332             break;
00333           }
00334           URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "not found: " << file);
00335         }
00336 #ifdef WIN32
00337       }
00338 #endif
00339 
00340       if (found)
00341       {
00342         URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "found: " << file);
00343         root_ = dir / "..";
00344         URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "root directory is: " << root_);
00345       }
00346     }
00347     else
00348     {
00349       root_ = argv0.substr(0, pos) / "..";
00350       URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_,
00351                       "invoked with a path, setting root to parent directory: "
00352                       << root_);
00353     }
00354   }
00355 
00356   if (root_.empty())
00357     URBI_ROOT_FATAL(program_, 3,
00358                     "Unable to find Urbi SDK installation location. "
00359                     "Please set URBI_ROOT.");
00360 
00361   if (!static_build)
00362   {
00363     handle_libjpeg_      = library_load("jpeg4urbi");
00364     handle_libport_      = library_load("port");
00365     handle_libsched_     = library_load("sched");
00366 #ifdef LIBPORT_ENABLE_SERIALIZATION
00367     handle_libserialize_ = library_load("serialize");
00368 #endif
00369     handle_liburbi_      = library_load("urbi");
00370   }
00371 }
00372 
00373 RTLD_HANDLE
00374 UrbiRoot::library_load(const std::string& base, const std::string& env_suffix)
00375 {
00376   std::string envvar;
00377   if (env_suffix.empty())
00378     envvar = "ROOT_LIB" + base;
00379   else
00380     envvar = "ROOT_LIB" + env_suffix;
00381   foreach (char& s, envvar)
00382     s = toupper(s);
00383 
00384   return
00385     xdlopen(program_,
00386             base,
00387             urbi_getenv(program_, envvar,
00388                         root() / libdir / "lib" + base + LIBPORT_LIBSFX));
00389 }

00392 UrbiRoot::root() const

00397 std::string
00398 UrbiRoot::core_path() const
00399 {
00400   return root() / LIBPORT_LIBDIRNAME / "gostai";

00403 std::vector<std::string>
00404 UrbiRoot::uobjects_path() const
00405 {
00406   std::vector<std::string> res;
00407   if (*LIBPORT_LIBSFX)
00408     res.push_back(core_path() / "uobjects" LIBPORT_LIBSFX);
00409   res.push_back(core_path() / "uobjects");
00410   return res;
00411 }

00414 UrbiRoot::share_path() const

00418 
00419 void
00420 UrbiRoot::load_plugin()
00421 {
00422   handle_libuobject_ =
00423     xdlopen(program_,
00424             "plugin UObject implementation",
00425             urbi_getenv(program_, "ROOT_LIBPLUGIN",
00426                         core_path() / "engine" / "libuobject" LIBPORT_LIBSFX),
00427             // This exit status is understood by the test suite.  It
00428             // helps it skipping SDK Remote tests that cannot run
00429             // without Urbi SDK.
00430             EX_OSFILE);
00431 }
00432 
00434 void
00435 UrbiRoot::load_remote()
00436 {
00437   handle_libuobject_ =
00438     xdlopen(program_,
00439             "remote UObject implementation",
00440             urbi_getenv(program_, "ROOT_LIBREMOTE",
00441                         core_path() / "remote" / "libuobject" LIBPORT_LIBSFX),
00442             EX_OSFILE);
00443 }
00444 
00445 void
00446 UrbiRoot::load_custom(const std::string& path_)
00447 {
00448   handle_libuobject_ =
00449     xdlopen(program_,
00450             "custom UObject implementation",
00451             path_ / "libuobject",
00452             EX_OSFILE);
00453 }

00455 typedef int(*urbi_launch_type)(int, const char*[], UrbiRoot&);
00456 int
00457 UrbiRoot::urbi_launch(int argc, const char** argv)
00458 {
00459   urbi_launch_type f =
00460     xdlsym<urbi_launch_type>(program_,
00461                              "liburbi-launch", handle_liburbi_,
00462                              "urbi_launch");
00463   return f(argc, argv, *this);
00464 }
00465 
00466 int
00467 UrbiRoot::urbi_launch(int argc, char** argv)
00468 {
00469   return urbi_launch(argc, const_cast<const char**>(argv));
00470 }
00471 
00472 typedef int(*urbi_main_type)(const std::vector<std::string>& args,
00473                              UrbiRoot& root,
00474                              bool block, bool errors);
00475 int
00476 UrbiRoot::urbi_main(const std::vector<std::string>& args,
00477                     bool block, bool errors)
00478 {
00479 #ifdef STATIC_BUILD
00480   return ::urbi_main_args(args, *this, block, errors);
00481 #else
00482   urbi_main_type f =
00483     xdlsym<urbi_main_type>(program_,
00484                            "libuobject", handle_libuobject_,
00485                            "urbi_main_args");
00486   URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "command line: ");
00487   foreach (const std::string& arg, args)
00488     URBI_ROOT_DEBUG(program_, "  " << arg);
00489 
00490   return f(args, *this, block, errors);
00491 #endif
00492 }
